Detailed Description

A twelve note series, i.e twelfe times a Note.

Interface to an array of twelfe different notes.

See also:
CompactSeries

Member Enumeration Documentation

anonymous enum
 

See also:
TonalError
Enumeration values:
TE_DEFAULT  same as TE_FOURTH|TE_CHORD|TE_EQ_INTERV

enum Series::TonalError
 

error code for tonal pharses

See also:
TE_DEFAULT
Enumeration values:
TE_OK  no error
TE_FOURTH  fourth or fifth
TE_CHORD  major or minor chord
TE_EQ_INTERV  three equal intervals in a row
TE_ALL_INTERV  not all intervales appear in series

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Series::Series (   )  [inline]
 

plain c'tor

Note:
This c'tor does not initialize, and thus might hold an invalid series.

Series::Series (  const std::string &  _s  )  [inline, explicit]
 

Construct series form a string.

Parameters:
_s input string
Each note is represented by an uppercase char, where 'A' corresponds to Note::TONE_MIN and the 'L' corsseponds to Note::TONE_MAX. An optional, preceeding lowercase char indicates the octave value, where 'a' stands for Note::OCT_MIN

Example: 

 Series("iGiAiJiKBiEiCiFiIiHiLiD")

Note:
No error checking is performed.

Member Function Documentation

unsigned Series::FindDoubled (   )  const
 

return the first note, which occurs twice

Returns:
0 if ok. Otherwise, the position of the first doubled note (ignoring octave information) is returned.
Note:
Series with doubled notes cause undefined behaviour with other methods of this class, except the STL container interface methods.

TonalErrorPos Series::FindError (  int  _iError  )  const
 

find tonal error

_iError
bitwise or'ed combination of tonal error codes (cf. TonalError).
Returns:
error position or (0,TE_OK) if no error
Find the first tonal error, where tonal errors with lower code are found first. If TE_ALL_INTERV is enabled, TE_FOURTH and TE_EQ_INTERV are ignored. The error position is the last note of the tonal pharse, e.g. if you test for TE_EQ_INTERV and you have "c", "d", "e", "f sharp" in your series, the error position would point to "f sharp".

See also:
transform_error_pos(const TonalErrorPos&)

std::string Series::get_string (   )  const
 

Return the series as string of length 24.

For the format of the string cf. Series(const std::string&)).

Series Series::GetNormalized (   )  const
 

get normalized form

The normalized form is the lexicalographical (ignoring octave value) minimal form out of the 48 forms. The octave values are choosen such, that the first note is either #Note::OCT_NONE or 0.

See also:
IsNormalized()const

bool Series::IsNormalized (   )  const
 

test, whether series is normalized

This method tests, whether the series is the lexicalographical smallest (ignoring octave information) out of its own 48 forms.

See also:
GetNormalized()const

unsigned Series::transform_error_pos (  const TonalErrorPos &   )  [static]
 

returns position of first note, which caused error

See also:
